content: square every so often after round 5 it should be 2 ² 6 round 6 2dc treble_crochet 3dc treble_crochet 2dc 9 sts per side the trebles are worked before and after the black trebles from the last round you will be working the trebles into the front of the second and next to last stitches of round 4 again this is a common feature of this pattern round 7 2dc treble_crochet 2dc x 3 11 sts per side the two ends of the side are worked the same as round 6 but there is an extra treble stitch in the middle of the sides 7 round 8 change to c2 for the next two coloured rounds 5dc treble_crochet double_crochet treble_crochet 5dc 13 sts per side now you re back to just working trebles on either side of the central treble from the last round the square should now measure 3 ² and you can see the star starting to emerge round 9 2dc treble_crochet twice 3dc treble_crochet 2dc twice 15 sts per side the sides on this round have three dcs in the middle with a symmetrical pattern of trebles separated by two dcs on either side the first and last trebles are worked into the second and next to last stitch from round 7 the other two are worked on either side of the coloured trebles from round 8 8 round 10 8dc treble_crochet 8dc 17 sts per side a nice simple round with just one treble in the middle of each side to finish the coloured star round 11 2dc treble_crochet x 3 double_crochet treble_crochet 2dc x 3 19 sts per side this is a similar pattern to round 9 but with three repeats on either side of the centre of each side rather than two your square should now measure 4 ² round 12 this is the simplest of the rounds giving no clue that it is the start of the box pattern to come change to c3 and just work double_crochet in all 21 stitches on each side 9 round 12 round 13 2dc treble_crochet 3dc treble_crochet 2dc x 3 21 sts per side if round 12 was the easiest round of the pattern then this one is probably the hardest to keep track of again the trebles at each end of the side are worked into the second and next to last stitches the two central trebles should frame the last pair of black trebles from round 11 other than that - all i can suggest is that you count carefully as you go round 14 this is where the lines of little boxes appear making it easier to keep track of your stitches 4dc treble_crochet double_crochet treble_crochet 4dc x 3 25 sts per side 10 the three sets of three coloured dcs from round 12 are the bases of the boxes which are separated by four groups of 4dc that s the last of the coloured rounds the final two rounds are worked in
